translation.en: [narrator] In 39 A.D.,
Caligula is one of the most powerful men in the world.
translation.zh: ‎卡利古拉是世界上最有权势的人之一

translation.en: But he will come to be known
as Rome's mad emperor.
[narrator] In just over a century, the Roman Empire has doubled in size.
translation.zh:
‎仅仅在一百多年里
‎罗马帝国的疆域扩大了一倍

translation.en: Now stretching nearly two million square miles
from the Atlantic Ocean to Egypt.
The city of Rome is rapidly expanding,
[Tom Holland] Rome was an enormous city,
even by the standards of today.
And there was a sense in which
infrastructure had been key to its growth, right from the very beginning.
translation.zh: ‎基础建设就被认为是发展关键

translation.en: And the engineering feat was
indeed formidable.
[narrator] Roadways now connect Rome to places like Northern Africa,
modern-day France, and Spain.
translation.zh: ‎现今的法国和西班牙等地方

translation.en: And advancements in design, like aqueducts...
sewer systems...
and amphitheaters...
have turned Rome into one of the most
advanced civilizations on the planet.
[Mike Duncan] Rome was as powerful as it had ever been,
and was continuing to grow in power.
They were at the zenith of their power.
when it came to its position
relative to other foreign powers, Rome was the biggest power in the world.
translation.zh:
‎比起其他外国势力
‎罗马是当时世界上最强大的政权

translation.en: [narrator] Rome's rise to global dominance
is in part thanks to its powerful military,
made up of nearly 300,000 soldiers.
The Roman military dominated the Western world.
There was nothing to match the Roman military.
[narrator] The Roman army has been waging a war against barbarians in Germania,
translation.zh:
‎罗马军队一直
‎在日耳曼尼亚对蛮夷作战

translation.en: hoping to keep their borders secure.
Rome has spent years and years fighting on the German frontier,
translation.zh: ‎罗马常年在日耳曼边境征战

translation.en: to ensure that the German tribes were not able to come and march into Gaul
translation.zh: ‎确保日耳曼部落无法侵犯高卢

translation.en: or into other parts of the Empire.
So it's a very big operation.
translation.zh: ‎所以这是很大规模的军事行动

translation.en: [man] Here, take this.
Hold it high and strong.
Feet apart.
[narrator] On the sidelines of the battlefield...
...a young Caligula is growing up.
For the first years of his life,
Caligula was pretty much on the road,
going from military camp to military camp.
His playground was, effectively, the most violent arena of war.
translation.zh: ‎他的游乐场实际上是最暴力的战场

translation.en: Caligula is brought up in a household of great privilege, great expectations.
translation.zh:
‎卡利古拉生长在特权家庭
‎家人对他有极高的期望

translation.en: Because he was the son of a great general.
And not only was his father a great general,
translation.zh: ‎不仅仅因为他父亲是大将军

translation.en: a man of honor, but he was the nephew of the ruling emperor of Rome.
translation.zh:
‎战功卓越 还因为他是
‎罗马帝国皇帝的侄子

translation.en: [narrator] Caligula's father is the most beloved leader in the Roman army,
translation.zh:
‎卡利古拉的父亲是罗马军队中
‎最受人爱戴的将领

translation.en: and next in line to become emperor of Rome.
His name is Germanicus.
[Germanicus] How many men to a cohort?
Four hundred and eighty.
How many to a legion?
One thousand.
Five thousand.
Led by?
Six tribunes...
[Amanda Ruggeri] Germanicus was a blue-blooded Roman prince.
translation.zh: ‎日尔曼尼库斯是尊贵的罗马王子

translation.en: The guy was handsome, he was charming,
he was well-educated.
[Amanda Ruggeri] He was, at the time, the most respected general in Rome.
translation.zh: ‎他是当时罗马最受人尊敬的将军

translation.en: So Caligula as a child would have been growing up
as the son of this incredibly popular guy,
and he is traveling around with his father
all throughout his young childhood.
Are you tired, or should we move onto weapons?
translation.zh:
‎你累了吗
‎还是接着去复习武器知识？

translation.en: Weapons.
-Javelins are made of... -Wood and iron.
-Short swords? -Steel.
[narrator] Germanicus trains Caligula to be a great warrior,
translation.zh:
‎日尔曼尼库斯将卡利古拉
‎训练成善战的武士

translation.en: forming a close bond between father and son,
but that's all about to change.
While Germanicus protects Rome's borders,
translation.zh:
‎就在日尔曼尼库斯
‎守护罗马边界的时候

translation.en: nearly a thousand miles away,
the reigning emperor, Tiberius, works to protect his legacy.
translation.zh:
‎当时的皇帝提贝里乌斯
‎也在极力保住自己的皇位

translation.en: Tiberius was not a natural politician.
translation.zh: ‎提贝里乌斯不是天生的政治人物

translation.en: Anything but.
He was charmless in many ways,
he had many enemies,
he clashed with the Senate.
He ended up leading the trial and execution of numerous senators.
translation.zh: ‎最后还审判并处决了多位元老

translation.en: Under Tiberius, Rome underwent a reign of terror.
translation.zh:
‎在提贝里乌斯的执政下
‎罗马陷入恐怖统治

translation.en: [narrator] Tiberius is only the second emperor Rome has ever had,
translation.zh:
‎提贝里乌斯只不过是
‎罗马的第二位皇帝

translation.en: but he spends much of his reign in the shadow of his predecessor.
translation.zh: ‎但他一直处于前任的阴影中

translation.en: [Adrian Murdoch] The previous emperor, Augustus, was the greatest emperor that Rome ever had.
translation.zh:
‎前任奥古斯都
‎是罗马历史上最伟大的皇帝

translation.en: He managed to do the impossible.
He brought Rome together,
he brought the provinces together,
but on the other hand, the emperor Tiberius was the emperor of austerity.
translation.zh:
‎但另一方面 提贝里乌斯
‎是厉行节约的皇帝

translation.en: There was none of the glamour of Augustus,
he didn't want to push the Empire forward.
[narrator] Caligula's father, Germanicus, may be next in line to be emperor of Rome...
translation.zh:
‎卡利古拉的父亲日尔曼尼库斯
‎可能是下任皇帝的继位者

translation.en: ...but Tiberius wants to pass on the throne to his son.
translation.zh: ‎但提贝里乌斯想把皇位传给他儿子

translation.en: So he makes a move to take out Germanicus.
translation.zh: ‎所以他动手要除掉日尔曼尼库斯

translation.en: [soldier] Guards!
[soldier 1] Don't touch him.
[soldier 2] What happened?
[narrator] Caligula is only seven years old when his father dies suddenly,
translation.zh: ‎父亲猝死的时候 卡利古拉才七岁

translation.en: leaving him, his two brothers, and three sisters without a father.
translation.zh:
‎留下他和两个兄弟
‎和三个姐妹相依为命

translation.en: And the Roman Empire
with no designated successor to the throne.
Germanicus, Caligula's father, was very, very popular,
translation.zh:
‎卡利古拉的父亲日尔曼尼库斯
‎深受民众爱戴

translation.en: and he's often regarded as the greatest emperor that Rome never had.
translation.zh:
‎他经常被认为将会是
‎罗马历史上最伟大的皇帝

translation.en: When Caligula's father died, life became a lot less comfortable.
translation.zh:
‎卡利古拉的父亲去世后
‎他的生活就没有那么如意了

translation.en: It doesn't take a professional psychologist to realize
translation.zh: ‎不用专业的心理分析师也知道

translation.en: quite what a damaged boy Caligula must have been.
[narrator] After his sudden death,
the family of Germanicus is convinced that he was poisoned.
translation.zh:
‎日尔曼尼库斯的家人
‎深信他是被人下毒

translation.en: [Anthony Everitt] His wife, Agrippina, was enraged,
translation.zh: ‎他的妻子阿格里皮娜非常愤怒

translation.en: and she was convinced that the emperor had assassinated
her much-loved husband, and she wouldn't keep quiet.
translation.zh: ‎她深爱的丈夫 她不会保持沉默

translation.en: Caligula's mother was a master of mobilizing public opinion.
translation.zh: ‎卡利古拉的母亲是舆论动员的高手

translation.en: [Corey Brennan] One of the things that she did was she worked Rome into hysteria
translation.zh: ‎在她丈夫日耳曼尼库斯疑似被谋杀后

translation.en: after the alleged murder of her husband, Germanicus.
translation.zh: ‎她的一件事就是把罗马搞得人心惶惶

translation.en: And, in fact, she was viewed as very dangerous.
[narrator] With Agrippina spreading word that Germanicus has been murdered,
translation.zh:
‎阿格里皮娜散布
‎日尔曼尼库斯被谋杀的说法

translation.en: the people of Rome begin to turn on their emperor.
translation.zh: ‎使得罗马人民开始与皇帝对立

translation.en: [man] I've already paid off servants in their household.
translation.zh: ‎我已经买通了仆人和他们全家

translation.en: They'll testify they heard the sons commit treason. Once the Senate finds them guilty...
translation.zh:
‎他们将作证听到儿子们意图叛国
‎如果元老判定他们有罪…

translation.en: We'll have them executed.
Imprisoned
is what I was going to suggest.
It'll lessen suspicion, and as their uncle you'll appear merciful.
translation.zh:
‎这样不会让人起疑
‎你也能展现伯父的仁慈

translation.en: Shall I move forward?
Yes.
[narrator] Fearing a revolt,
Tiberius knows he has no choice
translation.zh: ‎提贝里乌斯知道他没有选择

translation.en: but to keep Agrippina quiet.
translation.zh: ‎只有让阿格里皮娜保持沉默

translation.en: [Caitlin Gillespie] Tiberius felt threatened by Germanicus' family,
translation.zh:
‎提贝里乌斯感受到了
‎来自日尔曼尼库斯家人的威胁

translation.en: who was regarded as the better heirs
to the throne than the family of Tiberius himself.
translation.zh: ‎比提贝里乌斯跟适合继承皇位

translation.en: And Agrippina gained pity over their family for his premature death.
translation.zh:
‎而且阿格里皮娜因为他的早逝
‎为他的家庭获取了同情

translation.en: [Agrippina] Run! Run!
There's a third son.
Find him.
He's not here.
Where is he?
[man] Take her, too.
[narrator] Caligula's mother and older brothers are rounded up by imperial guards,
translation.zh:
‎卡利古拉的母亲和哥哥们
‎被皇家卫兵带走

translation.en: and subjected to one of Tiberius' most infamous policies,
translation.zh:
‎面临提贝里乌斯
‎最臭名昭著的政策之一

translation.en: the treason trials.
If you had to put your finger on just one aspect of Tiberius' reign
translation.zh:
‎如果你指出了提贝里乌斯
‎执政的某个问题

translation.en: which made him more unpopular than any other one,
it was the treason trials, which was anyone who criticized the emperor,
translation.zh: ‎你就是在批评他 那就是叛国审判

translation.en: even verbal insults, not diminishing the state or treason to the state,
translation.zh:
‎即便是出言不逊
‎没有影响国家或叛国

translation.en: but just any criticism of the emperor was punishable in a court of law.
translation.zh: ‎只要批评这位皇帝就要受到法律惩罚

translation.en: This is how Caligula's entire family was eliminated.
translation.zh: ‎这就是卡利古拉家族被灭门的原因

translation.en: Caligula's mother was sent into exile.
His older brother was imprisoned and his other brother was executed.
translation.zh: ‎他的哥哥被关押 另一位被处死

translation.en: All because, essentially, they are seen as potential threats to Tiberius.
translation.zh:
‎只是因为他们
‎是提贝里乌斯的潜在威胁

translation.en: [narrator] Caligula and his three younger sisters are sent to live with their grandmother,
translation.zh:
‎卡利古拉和他三个妹妹
‎被送去和奶奶同住

translation.en: under the close watch of Tiberius' soldiers,
translation.zh: ‎期间受到提贝里乌斯士兵的严密监视

translation.en: never sure when the emperor will decide to eliminate them.
translation.zh: ‎不清楚什么时候皇帝会除掉他们

translation.en: It's hard to work out quite what a difficult childhood Caligula must've had.
translation.zh: ‎很难想象卡利古拉的童年有多痛苦

translation.en: In one sense, he was a marked man at every stage.
translation.zh:
‎某种意义上看
‎他一直都是引人注意的人

translation.en: His father was dead,
he was being kept effectively under house arrest in Rome.
So he will have grown up his entire life thinking,
translation.zh: ‎所以他在成长过程中无时不刻都在想

translation.en: "At midnight, there could be a knock on the door,
and someone with a knife could kill me."
[narrator] As he grows into a young man,
Caligula manages to keep his distance from Tiberius.
translation.zh: ‎卡利古拉顺利和提贝里乌斯保持距离

translation.en: But an unexpected death
is about to bring him face-to-face with the emperor.
In 23 A.D.,
Drusus, Tiberius' son,
translation.zh: ‎提贝里乌斯的儿子德鲁苏斯

translation.en: dies suddenly, at the age of 35.
Drusus was the next in line
to assume the throne.
And after Drusus' death,
Tiberius was shocked to the core.
There's not much new to report.
But there is a grumbling
about who now is to be considered the next in line.
I know this is difficult,
but it's time to start thinking about naming a new successor.
translation.zh: ‎现在该开始考虑新的继任者

translation.en: I'd be willing to step into that role if you decide it's necessary.
translation.zh:
‎如果你觉得有必要
‎我愿意站出来承担这个责任

translation.en: Let me think about it.
[narrator] While the cause of death is unclear,
there's only one man who will benefit from Drusus' demise,
translation.zh:
‎但只有一个人
‎能从德鲁苏斯的死中得到好处

translation.en: the head of the Praetorian Guard...
Sejanus.
[Aaron Irvin] Sejanus presented himself as nothing more than a loyal ally and servant of Tiberius.
translation.zh:
‎塞扬努斯展现出自己对
‎提贝里乌斯忠心耿耿

translation.en: And he did so through cultivating a friendship,
translation.zh: ‎他通过培养友谊做到了这一点

translation.en: a personal relationship with Tiberius,
but he was far more ambitious than perhaps Tiberius had in mind.
translation.zh: ‎但他的野心比提贝里乌斯想象的更大

translation.en: It took Tiberius completely by surprise.
He had never, it seems, expected that Sejanus would be capable
of such a betrayal.
[narrator] With his son dead,
and no one left to trust,
Tiberius begins to grow paranoid of everyone around him
translation.zh: ‎提贝里乌斯开始对周围的人疑神疑鬼

translation.en: and decides he needs to get out of Rome.
Anybody would've been paranoid in the emperor's palace at this stage.
translation.zh:
‎在这个阶段
‎皇宫里的任何人都是多疑的

translation.en: So Tiberius puts himself into a self-imposed exile on the Island of Capri.
translation.zh:
‎所以提贝里乌斯
‎将自己流放至卡普里岛

translation.en: And he never sets foot in Rome again, for the rest of his life.
translation.zh: ‎余生再也没有踏入罗马一步

translation.en: [narrator] Tiberius works quickly to select a new successor.
translation.zh: ‎提贝里乌斯迅速选出了新的继承人

translation.en: Caligula.
Find him.
Bring him to me.
Macro.
Tell no one.
Tiberius needed an heir because the Empire needed an emperor.
translation.zh:
‎提贝里乌斯需要继承人
‎因为帝国需要皇帝

translation.en: The Empire needed somebody at the top,
and after Drusus' death,
and the removal of the children of Germanicus apart from Caligula,
translation.zh:
‎除了卡利古拉
‎日耳曼尼库斯的孩子们都被带走了

translation.en: Caligula was the only person to fit the bill.
translation.zh: ‎卡利古拉是唯一符合的人选

translation.en: [narrator] Now out of Rome,
Tiberius hides out in his luxurious villa on Capri.
translation.zh:
‎提贝里乌斯
‎躲在卡普里岛豪华的行宫内

translation.en: Located in the Tyrrhenian Sea,
Capri is over 100 miles removed from Rome,
leaving Tiberius completely isolated from the Empire he runs.
translation.zh:
‎让提贝里乌斯
‎与他统治的帝国完全隔离

translation.en: [Barry Strauss] Tiberius lived in a villa modestly called the Villa Jovis,
translation.zh:
‎提贝里乌斯所住的行宫
‎低调的被称为朱庇特行宫

translation.en: "the Villa of Jupiter,"
as if Tiberius was some sort of god.
This villa is perched at the edge of a cliff at one end of the island,
translation.zh: ‎这个行宫建在岛屿一处边缘的悬崖上

translation.en: it's a very beautiful and dramatic spot.
And Tiberius engaged in a life of great decadence.
translation.zh: ‎提贝里乌斯过着荒淫无度的生活

translation.en: [narrator] Once settled in Capri,
Tiberius has full control over who may enter the island,
translation.zh: ‎提贝里乌斯完全掌控进出岛屿的人

translation.en: and spends the next few years
taking advantage of his newfound privacy,
by indulging in an excessive lifestyle.
The decadence was quite spectacular on Capri.
translation.zh: ‎卡普里岛上的堕落生活让人咋舌

translation.en: There was the finest food, there was the finest wines,
translation.zh: ‎有最好的食物 有最好的美酒

translation.en: there were the most beautiful prostitutes.
It was a very open and free lifestyle,
translation.zh: ‎非常开放和自由的生活方式

translation.en: but it became quite debauched, on every possible level.
translation.zh: ‎但在任何层面上 也变得非常荒淫

translation.en: The stories that we hear coming out of Capri are very much a reflection
translation.zh:
‎我们听到的卡普里岛的故事
‎充分反映了

translation.en: of how much the Roman people disliked Tiberius.
translation.zh: ‎罗马人民有多讨厌提贝里乌斯

translation.en: In these stories, he is presented as weird and bizarre.
translation.zh: ‎在这些故事中 他非常的古怪变态

translation.en: He watches people have sex around him in various and sundry ways.
translation.zh:
‎他看着周围的人
‎以千奇百怪地方式做爱

translation.en: For a 12-year period,
Caligula's life was filled with watching his closest family members become exiled
translation.zh:
‎卡利古拉眼睁睁地看着他的亲密家人
‎因为发言反对提贝里乌斯

translation.en: and killed for speaking out against Tiberius.
So in 31 A.D. when Caligula was called to the Island of Capri,
translation.zh:
‎所以在公元31年
‎卡利古拉被叫到卡普里岛上的时候

translation.en: we can only imagine the fear,
the apprehension that he must have felt at that time.
[guard] This is the son of Germanicus.
Is that true?
Yes.
You blame me for your father's death, don't you?
translation.zh: ‎你把父亲的死怪在我头上 是不是？

translation.en: Your mother always did.
So you've spent your entire life believing that I was the one responsible.
translation.zh: ‎所以毕生都觉得我是那个该负责的人

translation.en: I didn't kill your father.
He did.
[Tiberius] This is the man responsible for your father's murder.
translation.zh: ‎这个人要为你父亲的死负责

translation.en: The man who poisoned my son.
Sejanus thought himself worthy of the throne.
translation.zh: ‎塞扬努斯觉得自己能坐上王位

translation.en: So, one by one,
he got rid of everyone who stood in his path.
I am not the man you think I am.
See him to his room.
Certainly, that early relationship between Caligula and Tiberius
translation.zh: ‎卡利古拉和提贝里乌斯早期的关系

translation.en: would have been fraught with suspicion, with paranoia...
Caligula, a young man,
who now has to live with the guy who has ruined his life up to that point.
translation.zh: ‎现在必须和摧毁他前半生的人同住

translation.en: [narrator] Confined to his room,
Caligula finds himself forced to stay on Capri.
translation.zh: ‎卡利古拉发现自己被囚禁在卡普里岛

translation.en: Now, all he can do is wait to see what Tiberius has planned for him.
translation.zh:
‎现在他所能做的就是
‎等着看提贝里乌斯早如何处置他

translation.en: [Adrian Murdoch] Caligula was a hostage on Capri,
translation.zh: ‎卡利古拉在卡普里岛成了人质

translation.en: and if the emperor had had any problems, he could've been got rid of.
translation.zh: ‎如果皇帝有任何不满 他就会被除掉

translation.en: It's part of the old dictum of "Keep your friends close and your enemies closer."
translation.zh:
‎这就是俗话说的
‎“要亲近朋友 更要亲近敌人”

translation.en: Tiberius could keep a close eye with him,
translation.zh: ‎提贝里乌斯可以近距离监视他

translation.en: and would have no compunction about killing him at the slightest drop of a hat.
translation.zh: ‎可以毫无内疚地立刻杀死他

translation.en: [narrator] With Tiberius isolated on Capri,
translation.zh: ‎提贝里乌斯在卡普里岛上与世隔绝

translation.en: the Roman people are left without their leader,
causing irreversible damage to his reputation as an emperor.
translation.zh: ‎对他的声誉造成不可挽回的损害

translation.en: Tiberius decided to disappear to the island of Capri
translation.zh: ‎提贝里乌斯决定躲在卡普里岛

translation.en: and rule from a distance.
However, his retreat to Capri was not well-received.
translation.zh: ‎但他退到卡普里岛反响不佳

translation.en: And then all the rumors of the strange goings on at the island
translation.zh: ‎然后出现了岛上有怪事的种种传闻

translation.en: didn't really do his reputation much credit either.
Tiberius ruled in a way that he thought was what the Empire needed.
translation.zh:
‎提贝里乌斯觉得
‎他的这种统治是帝国需要的

translation.en: But he didn't go out of the way to look after people.
[Adrian Murdoch] It was this common touch that Tiberius missed at every stage of his career.
translation.zh:
‎提贝里乌斯掌权以来
‎就是少了这种亲和力

translation.en: And when he retired to Capri,
it was a "screw you" to the Senate.
[narrator] Removed from Rome,
Tiberius needs someone to keep the Empire running.
translation.zh:
‎提贝里乌斯需要有人
‎让帝国继续保持运转

translation.en: So he makes one of his most loyal soldiers the new head of the Praetorian Guard.
translation.zh:
‎所以他将自己最忠心的士兵
‎提拔为新的禁卫军首领

translation.en: His name is Macro.
Macro was responsible for the security of the fabric of Rome.
translation.zh: ‎马克洛要负责守卫整个罗马

translation.en: He knew every corner.
He knew all the shortcuts,
he knew all the factions and where everyone was going to be.
translation.zh: ‎他熟悉每个派系 每个人会去哪里

translation.en: When he was promoted to the Praetorian Guard,
this simply added another layer of power to him,
and he was, by the time he'd been promoted, a very, very powerful man.
translation.zh:
‎在他被提拔后
‎变成了非常有权势的人

translation.en: [narrator] Unsure of his fate,
Caligula has no choice but to wait out his time on the island as a prisoner,
translation.zh:
‎卡利古拉没有选择
‎只能在岛上等待自己作为囚犯的命运

translation.en: but he's not the only person staying in the emperor's villa.
translation.zh: ‎但他不是唯一一个住在皇帝行宫的人

translation.en: Tiberius' 12-year-old grandson, Gemellus, also lives in the palace.
translation.zh:
‎提贝里乌斯12岁的孙子
‎吉迈勒斯也住在这里

translation.en: Do you know why Caligula is here?
translation.zh: ‎你知道为什么卡利古拉在这里吗？

translation.en: I brought Caligula here because you're not ready.
translation.zh:
‎我带卡利古拉来
‎是因为你还没有准备好

translation.en: -But I'm your grandson! -It doesn't matter.
All anyone would see is a spoiled brat sitting on the throne,
translation.zh:
‎大家只会看到一个
‎被宠坏的小孩坐在皇位上

translation.en: -incapable of ruling an empire. -I'm capable.
You think if Caligula comes to power, he will let you live?
translation.zh:
‎你觉得要是卡利古拉有了权力
‎会让你活下去吗？

translation.en: You no longer have the luxury of childhood.
[narrator] While Gemellus could continue the family reign,
translation.zh: ‎虽然吉迈勒斯可以继承嫡传皇位

translation.en: Tiberius knows that by handing the throne to a child,
translation.zh:
‎但提贝里乌斯深知
‎把皇位交给一个小孩

translation.en: he'd be putting the entire Roman Empire in danger.
translation.zh: ‎会让整个罗马帝国陷入危险境地

translation.en: [Tiberius] The Senate is expecting me to name a new heir.
translation.zh: ‎元老院希望我提名新的继任者

translation.en: Your cousin, Gemellus, is the obvious choice.
translation.zh: ‎你的侄子吉迈勒斯是当然人选

translation.en: But he's young.
And even when he comes of age,
he was raised as my grandson.
Spoiled. Soft.
The Senate might prefer the son of Germanicus.
translation.zh: ‎元老院可能更中意日尔曼尼库斯之子

translation.en: You're naming me next in line?
I'm considering it.
Will you release my mother?
You earn my trust,
and I will.
[Amanda Ruggeri] Caligula was incredibly intelligent.
He was very savvy.
So when he's brought to Capri,
the entire time you have to imagine he's trying to figure out,
"How do I survive this?"
[male aide] There's been reports of ongoing unrest along the border of Gaul.
Germanic tribes from east of the Rhine have been crossing into the territory.
translation.zh:
‎来自莱茵河东部的日耳曼部落
‎一直进犯这个地区

translation.en: [Tiberius] Gemellus,
what would you suggest?
Can't we just send an army and attack them?
translation.zh: ‎我们就不能直接派军队去攻打吗？

translation.en: Caligula, do you agree?
[Caligula] The last thing we want is a full scale war with Germania.
translation.zh:
‎现在我们最不需要的就是
‎和日耳曼爆发全面战争

translation.en: We could send a legion to patrol the border,
translation.zh: ‎我们可以派一个军团去边境巡逻

translation.en: stationing them on the west bank with strict orders not to cross.
translation.zh: ‎驻扎在西岸 严格规定不得越界

translation.en: Their presence should be enough to deter the tribes from raiding.
translation.zh: ‎他们的存在应该足以阻止部落的袭击

translation.en: See to it a legion is sent to the Rhine.
With strict orders not to cross.
There was a process on the Island of Capri,
I mean, it was a dynamic,
in which Caligula and Gemellus were auditioning for the role of emperor.
translation.zh:
‎卡利古拉和吉迈勒斯
‎正在接受皇帝职务的遴选

translation.en: It's hard not to feel sorry for Gemellus, Tiberius' grandson.
translation.zh:
‎对于提贝里乌斯的孙子吉迈勒斯
‎你很难不觉得遗憾

translation.en: He should have been the natural successor to Tiberius,
translation.zh: ‎他应该是提贝里乌斯当然的继承人

translation.en: but it's notable also that Gemellus wasn't trained in the same way that Caligula was.
translation.zh:
‎但值得注意的是 吉迈勒斯
‎并未接受卡利古拉那样的训练

translation.en: [man] Capri's an interesting place, isn't it?
translation.zh:
‎卡普里岛是个
‎很有趣的地方 是不是？

translation.en: I don't envy your position.
It's all right.
You really do remind me of him.
Your father.
You knew my father?
I served with him when he was Consul.
translation.zh: ‎他当执政官的时候 我跟他是同事

translation.en: He would have made a great emperor, had he gotten the chance.
translation.zh:
‎如果他有机会
‎可以是一位伟大的皇帝

translation.en: The throne belonged to your father.
It belongs to you.
It was what Augustus wanted.
Instead, we've been left with a demented old man,
driving the Empire to its ruin.
If the Senate has any say in the matter, it'll be you who inherits the throne.
translation.zh:
‎如果元老院可以决定
‎应该又你继承皇位

translation.en: The sooner, the better.
Our sources are full of deliciously horrible stories
translation.zh: ‎关于提贝里乌斯在卡普里岛上

translation.en: about Tiberius on Capri.
translation.zh: ‎我们听到的都是耸人听闻的故事

translation.en: Tiberius supposedly had his enemies tossed from the top of the cliff into the sea.
translation.zh:
‎据说提贝里乌斯把敌人
‎从悬崖上扔到海里

translation.en: So Caligula could only have known how uneasy his position was,
translation.zh: ‎所以卡利古拉知道自己的位置不稳

translation.en: how dangerous it was to betray Tiberius' trust.
translation.zh: ‎背叛提贝里乌斯的信任有多危险

translation.en: Come. Sit.
[Tiberius] Would you like to join them?
If you want to be emperor one day,
you must learn what it means to live like an emperor.
Go on.
I insist.
[Anthony Everitt] Caligula was summoned by Tiberius
translation.zh: ‎卡利古拉被提贝里乌斯召来

translation.en: to train him up and to give him a little bit of his wisdom.
translation.zh: ‎训练他 把自己的一点智慧传授给他

translation.en: Tiberius encouraged Caligula in all kinds of vices around sex.
translation.zh:
‎提贝里乌斯鼓励卡利古拉
‎尝试各种奇怪的床上招式

translation.en: [Anthony Murdoch] The Romans were much more sexually liberated
translation.zh:
‎比起我们或文艺复兴时期
‎重新领域的人

translation.en: than certainly we were, or anyone rediscovering them in the Renaissance.
translation.zh: ‎罗马人在性方面都更加开放

translation.en: Also, the Romans tended not to care about sexual mores.
translation.zh: ‎而且罗马人并不在意性道德

translation.en: Listen to me very carefully. Are you listening?
Yes.
Do not speak unless spoken to.
translation.zh: ‎别说话 除非别人跟你说话

translation.en: Tell the truth.
And do not show any emotion.
-Understand? -Yeah.
I'd never speak out against you!
Ever! I swear!
She's lying!
I'm not.
What did he say to you?
[yells] What did he say?
He said-- He said that you're a demented old man.
And that if it were up to the Senate,
I should be the one to inherit the throne.
The sooner, the better.
Kill him.
The one thing we're told about how Caligula was able to ingratiate himself
translation.zh: ‎我们了解到的卡利古拉非常善于

translation.en: to Tiberius was not showing any emotion whatsoever.
translation.zh:
‎迎合提贝里乌斯
‎而且无论如何不会表露自己的情绪

translation.en: Tiberius was known for his dissimulation, for his hiding his emotions.
translation.zh:
‎提贝里乌斯以善于
‎掩饰和隐藏情绪而闻名

translation.en: And Caligula tried to out-Tiberius Tiberius.
translation.zh: ‎卡利古拉想要超过提贝里乌斯

translation.en: Living under the emperor Tiberius, there was every single reason to fear.
translation.zh:
‎在提贝里乌斯皇帝眼皮底下生活
‎绝对是胆战心惊

translation.en: [narrator] Six years after bringing Caligula to Capri,
translation.zh: ‎将卡利古拉带到卡普里岛六年后

translation.en: Tiberius has fallen ill.
But he still hasn't named a successor,
and now time is running out.
Tell me, honestly.
He doesn't have much time.
[narrator] With the emperor on his deathbed,
Macro knows he has to get Caligula on his side.
translation.zh: ‎马克洛知道必须拉拢卡利古拉

translation.en: [Macro] I'm sorry to interrupt.
Yes? What is it?
Your mother.
She's passed away.
When?
A few years ago.
I've just found out.
[Amanda Ruggeri] When Caligula finds out what happened to the rest of his family,
translation.zh: ‎当卡利古拉知道他仅存家人的消息

translation.en: his mother, his two brothers, he doesn't react.
translation.zh: ‎他的母亲 他的兄弟 他没有反应

translation.en: He has no emotional reaction.
He had simply learned that to react poorly
was almost certainly to bring some kind of punishment down on him,
whether that was exile, imprisonment, or execution.
translation.zh: ‎可能是被流放 被囚禁或处决

translation.en: [narrator] When Caligula arrived in Capri,
Tiberius' grandson, Gemellus, was a spoiled 12-year-old
translation.zh:
‎提贝里乌斯的孙子
‎吉迈勒斯是个被宠坏的12岁少年

translation.en: who believed he was entitled to the throne.
But now, at 18, Gemellus' bloodline
is the only thing keeping Caligula from becoming the next emperor.
translation.zh:
‎是阻止卡利古拉成为
‎下一位皇帝的唯一障碍

translation.en: The reality is that Caligula is beloved by the Roman people.
translation.zh: ‎事实是卡利古拉深受罗马人民爱戴

translation.en: Caligula has the ancestry,
he has the history, and all he really has to do is show up.
translation.zh: ‎他有过去 他只要现身就行

translation.en: And Caligula is immediately going to be better liked, more influential,
translation.zh:
‎比起吉迈勒斯 卡利古拉马上就能
‎更受爱戴 更有影响力

translation.en: and more powerful than Gemellus will be.
By considering Gemellus as his heir,
Tiberius is essentially trying to buy time for his grandson.
translation.zh:
‎提贝里乌斯实际上
‎是在为他的孙子争取时间

translation.en: Because the reality is is that if he doesn't become princeps,
translation.zh: ‎因为事实就是如果他不能当上皇帝

translation.en: that Gemellus could be killed because he is a liability.
translation.zh: ‎吉迈勒斯会被杀 因为他是个累赘

translation.en: [narrator] In 37 A.D.,
Tiberius makes his decision.
Tomorrow, in the Senate, there will be a reading of my final will.
translation.zh: ‎明天元老院将宣读我的遗嘱

translation.en: So there can be no confusion about my intentions.
I have decided...
the two of you shall rule together, as brothers.
translation.zh: ‎你们要像兄弟一样联手治理国家

translation.en: I'm naming you co-heirs to the throne.
Tiberius must have known that you can't split an empire in half.
translation.zh:
‎提贝里乌斯肯定知道
‎帝国不能一分为二

translation.en: I think he just decided to kind of leave it up to fate
translation.zh: ‎我觉得他就是有点听天由命

translation.en: and hope that something would work out.
[narrator] Caligula now has a choice:
respect Tiberius' wishes and share the throne,
translation.zh:
‎尊重提贝里乌斯的意愿
‎分享皇位

translation.en: or take out the one person standing in his way of becoming emperor.
translation.zh: ‎或者干掉这个阻止他成为皇帝的人
